1.str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

1.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
1.str2: To cover, conceal, ward off, bear with, endure patiently. From stege; to roof over, i.e. to cover with silence.
No longer, no more. From me and eti; no further.

1.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
1.str2: To be well-pleased, think it good, be resolved. From eu and dokeo; to think well of, i.e. Approve; specially, to approbate.
From kata and leipo; to leave down, i.e. Behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Athens, the intellectual capital of Greece. Plural of Athene; Athenoe, the capitol of Greece.

From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.

From a presumed derivative of histemi; to set fast, i.e. to turn resolutely in a certain direction, or to confirm.
From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
